page.title: 12TRANSPORT IN LERRYN & GOLANT
page.content: Not many{buses}come to{Lerryn. There is one on Tuesdays and Fridays to{St Austell,}and one on Thursday to {Bodmin.}None go to{Golant.}Most people use the buses to go shopping. If they only have small amounts of food and provisions to buy, they can shop at the village shop. The majority of people in{Lerryn {and Golant}have a car. All the children, apart from those of primary age in the{Lerryn}area, have to go to school on school buses, this means that some children have to leave home before 8 o'clock in the morning. In{Golant}they have a mini bus to take the children to school. The rest of the children either have to walk or are brought by their parents in cars. In some cases children travel to school by taxi.
